text.p: Here are the highlights of stories in the Danish press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
--Swedish high-street foreign exchange firm Forex plans to buy another, unamed, business, to double turnover of its exisiting Danish bureaux de change.
--A.P. Moeller's Maersk Oil's production in Qatar in June reached 96,000 barrels per day, compared to expectations of 75,000 bpd.
--American companies are staying out of Denmark because of high VAT on telecommunications.
--Copenhagen Airport estimates that its expansion programme will create 15,000 new jobs.
--Danish pork producers have invested billions of crowns in pig sties which do not meet rising standards for humane production.
--The millenium bug will cost Unibank 100 million crowns.
--Contrary to last year, KFX shars in the first six months of 1997 rose twice as much as the larger non-top 20 paper.
--Economy Minister Marianne Jelved says that Denmark is willing to pay in order to enlarge the EU eastward.
